clinical_study.brief_title: DilAtation Versus Endoscopic Laser Resection in Simple Benign trAcheal sTEnosis
clinical_study.official_title: Dilatation Versus Endoscopic Laser Resection in Simple Benign Tracheal Stenosis : a Randomized Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre de Recherche de l'Institut Universitaire de Cardiologie et de Pneumologie de Quebec

clinical_study.source: Institut universitaire de cardiologie et de pneumologie de Québec, University Laval

brief_summary.textblock: Multicenter randomized controlled trial comparing endoscopic laser resection vs dilatation in benign tracheal stenosis.

detailed_description.textblock: An observational study suggests the superiority of endoscopic laser resection over dilatation in idiopathic tracheal stenosis but little litterature has been published on the subject. Hence we decided to design a prospective multicenter open label randomized controlled trial to compare the two interventions. Patients refered for endoscopic treatment of a simple benign tracheal stenosis will be randomized to endoscopic laser resection or dilatation. Randomisation will be stratified for center, type of stenosis (idiopathic vs other) and history of previous endoscopic treatment. Patients will be blinded to treatment but not physician. All patients will be treated with proton pump inhibitors.

primary_outcome.measure: Relapse rate at 2 years of symptomatic tracheal stenosis (> 40%) requiring a new procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Relapse rate at 1 year of symptomatic tracheal stenosis (> 40%) requiring a new procedure
Time to first symptomatic relapse of tracheal stenosis
Measurement of stenosis by cephalo-caudal length at endoscopic follow-up at 1 year
Rate of surgical resection following symptomatic recurrence
Rate and type of complications and adverse effects depending on the procedure

other_outcome.measure: Relapse rate at 2 years of symptomatic tracheal stenosis (> 40%) requiring a new procedure in the idiopathic and non idiopathic subroup as well as in the first episode and recurrence subgroups

arm_group.description: Using CO2, diode or similar wavelenght laser the stenotic tracheal segment will be vaporized allowing a less than 20% residual stenosis. Dilatation will not be performed after laser resection for residual stenosis.
Using a ballon or rigid bronchoscope the stenotic tracheal segment will be dilated with or without previous radial incision with electrocautery or laser.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Benign simple tracheal stenosis (length of stenosis <1cm without underlying cartilage damage) with planned endoscopic treatment (first treatment or recurrence)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Less than 18 years old
- Pregnant
- Incapacity to give informed consent
- Underlying inflammatory suspected to be the cause of stenosis (ex : granulomatosis with polyangitis)

facility.name: Institut universitaire de cardiologie et de pneumologie de Québec (IUCPQ)
Hôpital Larrey, University Hospital of Toulouse

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Centre de Recherche de l'Institut Universitaire de Cardiologie et de Pneumologie de Quebec
